data.text:
In this episode 380, we feature Philadelphia author Sarahlyn Bruck, and her latest novel, Light of the Fire, which is both a mystery and exploration of the landscape of friendship between two people over time. A. J. Banner, #1 Kindle, Publishers Weekly, and USA Today bestselling author, calls Light of Fire “[a] deftly crafted, moving novel of friendship and family, the weight of long-kept secrets, and the healing power of owning up to our mistakes. Absorbing, heartrending, and ultimately hopeful, Light of the Fire is unputdownable.”

Show discussion highlights:

Growing up in Northern California

Finding time to write while teaching full time

Inspiration behind Light of the Fire

Weaving a mystery into a novel about friendship

Writing about forgiveness and other themes in the book

Character development and writing from three points of view

How teaching influences Sarahlyn’s writing

Things she’s learned from her students

Publishing with Amazon’s traditional pub house

Best advice she’s received from and given to her students

Brief author bio: Sarahlyn Bruck writes contemporary, book club fiction and is the award-winning author of three novels: Light of the Fire (coming January 2024), Daytime Drama (2021), and Designer You (2018). When she’s not writing, Sarahlyn moonlights as a full-time writing and literature professor at a local community college. From Northern California, she now lives in Philadelphia with her family.

For the latest book news, events, and announcements, check out her website and subscribe to her newsletter. Follow her on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter at @sarahlynbruck.
